intro: Acer theiferum, commonly known as the red maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its distinctive red foliage in autumn, which makes it a popular ornamental species. The tree has opposite, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red, orange, and yellow in the fall. Its flowers are small and green, appearing in early spring before the leaves emerge. Acer theiferum typically grows to a height of 10–25 meters and thrives in a variety of soil types.
